column4: hello, by using firefox and adobe flash plugin I get really high CPU usage, is this normal?
depend on the flash media your viewing
also dpends on the performance of your machine
thanks for the info, if it is known I guess it is not local fault
no no, you shouldn't get it by default, but as I said, it depends on what you are viewing and the spec of your machine
shouldn't be getting %100 on those things, are you just watching them in firefox,
even when they paused and low quality setting they eat 50% cpu
how are you on ram and useable disk space ?
786MB RAM half full and other half as cache file system is 11% full
so you should be pretty comfortable with that
did you install using the ubuntu package "flashplugin-nonfree"
thats the one installed, done automagically by firefox and apt
ohh well just asked before I tinker with it, if I break it more then I come for more questions I think
sounds goo, but I don't think you should be seeing that much cpu us on idle
